truth: -  "Ionic bonding involves the transfer of electrons from one atom to another."
fiction: -  "Ionic bonding involves the transfer of protons from one atom to another."

truth: -  "Covalent bonding occurs when two atoms share electrons."
fiction: -  "Covalent bonding occurs when two atoms share their atomic nuclei."

truth: -  "In a polar covalent bond, electrons are shared unequally between atoms."
fiction: -  "In a polar covalent bond, electrons are shared equally between atoms."

truth: -  "Hydrogen bonds are a type of weak chemical bond."
fiction: -  "Hydrogen bonds are a type of strong nuclear bond."

truth: -  "Metallic bonding occurs between metal atoms."
fiction: -  "Metallic bonding occurs between non-metal atoms."

truth: -  "In a single bond, two electrons are shared between atoms."
fiction: -  "In a single bond, two protons are shared between atoms."

truth: -  "A double bond involves the sharing of four electrons."
fiction: -  "A double bond involves the sharing of four neutrons."

truth: -  "In a triple bond, six electrons are shared between atoms."
fiction: -  "In a triple bond, six protons are shared between atoms."

truth: -  "The bond length is the average distance between the nuclei of two bonded atoms."
fiction: -  "The bond length is the average distance between the electrons of two bonded atoms."

truth: -  "The bond angle is the angle formed between three atoms across at least two bonds."
fiction: -  "The bond angle is the angle formed between three electrons across at least two bonds."

truth: -  "Van der Waals forces are weak intermolecular forces."
fiction: -  "Van der Waals forces are strong intramolecular forces."

truth: -  "A dative bond, also known as a coordinate bond, involves a donor atom giving both electrons in a bond."
fiction: -  "A dative bond, also known as a coordinate bond, involves a donor atom giving both protons in a bond."

truth: -  "The octet rule states that atoms tend to form bonds in such a way that they have eight electrons in their outermost shell."
fiction: -  "The octet rule states that atoms tend to form bonds in such a way that they have eight protons in their outermost shell."

truth: -  "In metallic bonding, electrons are delocalized and move freely."
fiction: -  "In metallic bonding, protons are delocalized and move freely."

truth: -  "The Lewis structure is a graphical representation of the arrangement of electrons in a molecule."
fiction: -  "The Lewis structure is a graphical representation of the arrangement of protons in a molecule."

truth: -  "Resonance structures are used to represent a molecule where the bonding cannot be expressed by one single Lewis structure."
fiction: -  "Resonance structures are used to represent a molecule where the bonding cannot be expressed by one single Bohr model."

truth: -  "A sigma bond is the strongest type of covalent bond."
fiction: -  "A sigma bond is the weakest type of covalent bond."

truth: -  "A pi bond is weaker than a sigma bond."
fiction: -  "A pi bond is stronger than a sigma bond."

truth: -  "The VSEPR theory is used to predict the shape of individual molecules based on the number of electron pairs surrounding their central atoms."
fiction: -  "The VSEPR theory is used to predict the color of individual molecules based on the number of electron pairs surrounding their central atoms."

truth: -  "Intramolecular forces are the forces that hold atoms together within a molecule."
fiction: -  "Intramolecular forces are the forces that hold molecules together within a compound."

truth: -  "Intermolecular forces are the forces of attraction between molecules."
fiction: -  "Intermolecular forces are the forces of attraction within a molecule."

truth: -  "Polar molecules have a net dipole as a result of opposing charges."
fiction: -  "Polar molecules have a net dipole as a result of identical charges."

truth: -  "Nonpolar molecules have no net dipole as a result of equal sharing of electrons."
fiction: -  "Nonpolar molecules have no net dipole as a result of unequal sharing of electrons."
